feed.title: Michael Hotaling
feed.subtitle: An easy to use blogging platform with support for Jupyter Notebooks.

entry.title: The Great Tohoku earthquake and the Fukushima Daiichi Accident

link.title: The Great Tohoku earthquake and the Fukushima Daiichi Accident

entry.summary: The Tohoku earthquake was the most powerful earthquake ever recorded in Japan, and the fourth most powerful earthquake in the world since modern record-keeping began in 1900. This notebook is an analysis into the earthquakes in Japan and how frequently Japan should expect earthquakes of varying magnitude based on linear regression

entry.title: Predicting Stock Market Prices Using a Recurrent Neural Network

link.title: Predicting Stock Market Prices Using a Recurrent Neural Network

entry.summary: There is a common belief that market movements are predictable using a number of technical indicators and chart patterns. If such signals do exhibit these fortune-telling properties, they should be detectable by a deep learning neural network and exploitable. In this post, we will examine these possibilities by designing a recurrent neural network in keras-tensorflow and see just how much money we can make.

entry.title: Solving Wordle Using Information Theory
entry.summary: Wordle has gone pretty viral in the last couple months. It's a very simple game where you have to guess a five letter word within six guesses. Each guess reveals some information about what letters are in the word and in what positions. The faster you get the word, the better your score.
